document_data.name: Church of Sebek
document_data.mainbody: The '''Church of Sebek''' was a collection of [[specialty priest]]s called [[swamplord]]s and [[cleric]]s devoted to [[Sebek]], the [[Crocodile]] [[God]] of the [[Mulhorandi pantheon]].
document_data.Organization: Most of the clergy within the church were swamplords and [[werecrocodile]]s. Titles used among the clergy included Glistening Jaws, Watery Death, Scales of Vengeance, Hungry Maw, and Bloody Teeth. Members of the clergy advanced in rank by besting their peers in combat.
document_data.Activities: Members of Sebek's clergy were required to slay at least one sentient creature per month to retain their powers. They were also required to create at least one werecrocodile per year from the population of Mulhorand.<ref name="PaP-p124-126/>
document_data.Celebrations: Sebek's clergy whispered their thanks with each kill and left a small portion for Sebek to claim if he so desired.
document_data.Base of Operations: Sebek's worship was isolated mostly within the [[Old Empires]] region of [[east Faerûn]] in [[Unther]], [[Mulhorand]], and [[Chessenta]]. The vast majority of Sebek's temples were simple huts or shrines found in or near swamps. The largest temple, [[the River's Maw]] was located in the city of [[Sekras]] in Unther.
document_data.Orders: There existed no knightly orders devoted to Sebek.
document_data.History: The Church of Sebek was nearly annhilated in the {{YearlinkName|1183}}, by [[paladin]]s of [[Osiris]] who slew most of Sebek's faithful in Sekras. Those who survived fled, later gathering in Chessenta within the [[Adder Swamp]].
